div.p: I think for me from the age of sort of 15 when I was permanently excluded from Sandford School I sort of realised I was
severely dyslexic, I thought at the time I was a young black gangsta so to speak, I didn’t really have anybody in my life
as a positive role model apart from my mum but I never had any male influence in my life so I felt at that time the way forward
for me was just to be a gang banger, I thought well I’m going to be like my uncles and my cousins who were driving around
in their nice 30 grand cars with their nice bracelets and nice chains and stuff so I thought that’s the life for me so from the age
of 15 up to the age of 21 I just thought yeah that’s what I did, I sold drugs, I took drugs, I had a little time in prison
not for drug dealing but for violence so yeah I never really had any positive role models but then at the same time I had
my cousins and my uncles who I did look up as role models at that time in my life whereas now I feel sorry for them because
they’re still in that lifestyle but as you know in the game of drugs you’re there for a certain time and then one day you just
have to hang it up and be like “do you know what it’s not me no more” and they’re still trying to be like that so, what, 15 years on
of me turning around my life they’re still trying to be that young, bad boy.
I had influences in my life who came into my life like my youth workers and my few peers coming to me and saying
“look Del you need to stop doing that” and whatever but it just went in one ear and out the other because they weren’t consistent
in my life they were just people who’d come in every now and again or if they see me in town they were like “tell me what you’re up to,
are you still doing what you were doing?” and I’m like “no, no, no I’m giving it up” and whatever but no I wasn’t I just told them
what they wanted to hear so at that time I’d become a bit of a conscious young male but then I’d go back to what I was doing
10 minutes after when my phone rang and I was meeting a punter or whatever so yeah I never really had anybody to
sort of influence me massively, no.
I know I am different to a lot of my other black associate friends, do you know what I mean, I know I am and they say it all the time
like “you don’t talk like a black man, you don’t walk like a black man, you don’t act like a black man” how should I be acting?
Society says so that I should be, what, wearing my trousers half way down my arse? Having all sovereigns on my fingers?
Having a big chain? Having a bandana hanging out my butt? Come on we’re in the 20th Century for God’s sake and like they hear
what I’m saying, they do, I know they do, but it’s better for them to be stubborn and be like “do you know Del’s right but I’m not going to tell him...”
